Rating: ★★★★★  (5/5)

Attention, streamers and virtual adventurers! Get ready to bring your streams to life with Stream Avatars, Steam's delightful app that adds a touch of whimsy and interactivity to your live broadcasts. With its charming avatars, customization options, and engaging interactions, Stream Avatars transforms your streaming experience into an immersive virtual playground. Here's why Stream Avatars is a must-have for streamers looking to entertain and connect with their audience:

Avatar Magic:

Stream Avatars introduces a delightful cast of customizable avatars that become the virtual embodiment of you or your viewers. From cute animals to fantastical creatures, the avatars add a visual flair to your stream, instantly capturing the attention and imagination of your audience. They bring an element of fun and excitement to your content, making your streams more engaging and memorable.

Interactive Entertainment:

Stream Avatars takes interactivity to the next level. Viewers can claim their own avatars, customize them, and actively participate in your stream by triggering special actions or emotes associated with their avatars. This creates a dynamic and playful environment, fostering a sense of community and encouraging viewers to interact with each other and with you. The interactive nature of Stream Avatars turns your stream into a shared experience rather than a one-way broadcast.

Endless Customization:

The app provides an array of customization options for both streamers and viewers. Streamers can personalize their avatars, choosing from various accessories, outfits, and animations to match their style or theme. Viewers can also customize their avatars, allowing them to express their individuality and stand out in the virtual crowd. This level of customization enhances the sense of ownership and connection, making the avatars an extension of each participant's personality.

Mini-Games and Challenges:

Stream Avatars introduces entertaining mini-games and challenges that viewers can participate in, adding a layer of excitement and friendly competition to your stream. From interactive quizzes to avatar duels and treasure hunts, these activities encourage viewer engagement, create memorable moments, and even offer rewards. The inclusion of mini-games and challenges adds depth to your stream, keeping viewers entertained and eager to participate.

Seamless Integration:

Stream Avatars seamlessly integrates with popular streaming platforms, ensuring a smooth setup process and compatibility with your existing streaming software. The app provides a user-friendly interface that allows you to configure avatars, interactions, and customization options with ease. The straightforward integration saves you time and effort, allowing you to focus on creating engaging content and fostering viewer interactions.

Conclusion:

Stream Avatars is a delightful addition to any streamer's toolbox, elevating the streaming experience to new heights of interactivity and entertainment. With its charming avatars, interactive features, endless customization options, engaging mini-games, and seamless integration, Stream Avatars transforms your streams into captivating virtual adventures. So, invite your audience to join you in this whimsical journey, where avatars come alive and connections flourish. In the realm of virtual avatars, Stream Avatars reigns supreme as Steam's ultimate extravaganza!

Stream Avatars is a great, albeit clunky tool for any streamer looking to recognise and reward their viewers with more than just shout outs.
The initial set up is fairly pain free and adding to your streaming software is fairly simple. Adding to your collection of avatars from the workshop is easy enough and there's a wide variety of content to choose from made by many talented people.

The issues present themselves if you want to go more in-depth. Importing your own avatars can be a real hassle. Even when you have the correct dimensions, Stream Avatars doesn't make it easy to match this in app. The sizing numbers often make little to no sense compared to your PNG spreadsheet that you have set to meet the sizing requirements and this can cause many visual glitches. 
When it works, however, it's a wonderful piece of kit; being able to set custom actions and FPS for each avatar is wonderful and adds to the overall customisation.

Mini-games, mass actions and gold are all here and again, when they work they're incredible. The problem is that they don't work as intended or as often as they should. I've check the Stream Avatars website for various instructions and searched FAQs but there's very little information out there on how to get these things to function correctly. Right now, the only consistent mini-games I have managed to get to work are Boss Fights and Battle Royale.

My experience with stream avatars started out bad from the start. Upon first setting up the avatars, it worked right out of the box flawlessly. As I began to play around with it, suddenly my 2nd attempt to render it in OBS failed. The avatars just wouldn't show up for the life of me. So my experience was spending the next 2 hours trying to fix it for my stream. Eventually it worked, but I do not know how or why it worked. So I just went live instead and let my audience play with the avatars.

For the next 2 days, no problems, so I thought my troubles were over. Then on the 3rd day, it just magically stopped working again, but this time I couldn't fix it. So I had to go a entire stream without it and apologize to my audience.

Eventually I went to where I was suppose to go, the stream avatars discord support page and posted my problems. Do you want to know what happened? The developer literally by-passed me and answered other people's questions, who were shorter / smaller in size. Yes, I literally got ignored. 

Therefor, since I gave this developer money and he/she has decided to ignore my support requests, I am giving this a overall negative review and negative experience.

As for the software itself, if you can get it to work, here is what I believe you can expect.

Pros:
Fun eventful avatars running across your screen.
People battling and duel each other.
Boss battles and mini-games for fun.

Everything you would basically come to expect with this software. Here is things you might not have thought of though, for cons.

Cons:
~ Even though sprite sizes are adjustable, if your going to a minamlistic look, they clutter up your screen.
~ Aftertime, the audience grows tired of playing with the avatars and ignores them.
~ Setup is not plug and play.
~ You have 18mb of upload. Some packages in the store are larger than this and you cannot even upload a single package without buying the 30mb upgrade, making it mandatory.
~ You will or will not get help from support. They decided to ignore me.

Take with this information what you will, but this is what I got when I bought stream avatars, and I guess you will have a similar experience. Note: This is definitely a software for streamers, would not buy if you are not a streamer. 
However if you are, I would absolutely recommend it. It's not very expensive and it has a lot of potential for what you can do with it. Even at its most basic form with sprites downloaded from others (free on steam workshop), it's really nice for the people in your chat to come in and see their avatar on the screen and play some of the mini games together.

If you're into making your own sprites, you can customize pretty much everything and make this very personalized. You can customize the avatars, boss, sounds, certain mini game sprites, etc. As someone who gets really into the customization of it all, I LOVE this. 100% recommend to any art streamers to mess around with making your own avatars. The bosses are more complicated to make and quite a lot of work, but if you're up to the challenge it's definitely an option. 

With the shop options, you can actually use this as a replacement for Sound Alerts. You just upload whatever sound file you want and add it into the shop. With everything in the shop (sounds, avatars, avatar accessories, avatar actions, avatar colours, and nametags) you can make it so your viewers can buy it with stream-avatar-earned coins or bits. You can also make it giftable-only if you want to give something special to someone that only they can use. You can also make it so only followers/subscribers/moderators can have certain things. So setting specific avatars/sounds/etc to followers only is really easy! 

Since viewers earn the coins the more time they watch your stream or through participating in games, it's a great way to encourage chat to stay active even when things are maybe going slow in stream. And you can use the avatars and sounds and other things as extra rewards they can get for spending the time in your stream! There's also the leaderboard for "richest" viewers, which... some viewers take very seriously 

All in all, whether you're just going to throw it together at the basic settings and let it work for you or get deep into customizing and have some extra fun with it, I think it's absolutely worth the buy if you're looking to add some extra fun to your stream.

[h1] About [/h1]
This program allows you to link it to your twitch and with a bit of fiddling, people can have avatars! This can be followers, or anyone! (sadly, even bots).

[hr][/hr]

[h1]The Good:[/h1]
- Easy. Mega easy. You load up the program and it's pretty good for beginners because you can just load up any ol' avatar collection. There's not a lot, but the ones they have are pretty good.
These are all set up and ready to go.

- You can add your own art instead, and make your own items for your characters. 
My stream has little cats (stream in profile). I made them myself, changed the colours with the palette editor in the program, and it's randomised when people follow me, everyone who follows gets a cat! That's super fun.

- The users can change the items for free or for fake 'gold' which they earn by watching your stream. You can make a hat cost 0 or 100000x whatevers. I don't really like to limit my watchers, so I just made all my items free, but it's preference.

-  You can have interactions. If you type !jump in the chat, your icon will jump. You can also type in like !fart, !hug, etc. for ...well....you know :P

- Games. This program allows the owner who is broadcasting to throw stars, throw the characters, have boss battles etc. I haven't got boss battles on mine because I haven't been bothered to do it yet, but I'll get there. There's some default bosses you can edit into it so you don't [b]need to do art, but it is super limited if you can't do pixel art.[/b]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]The Bad: [/h1]
- Unfortunately if you don't do pixel art, you wont be completely lost, but it is very limited.
The work they do have is very good though. 

- It's a bit difficult, I struggle a lot with aligning hats and things. Sometimes the item will reset it's positioning, and this causes me pain having to do it over and over again for each item. (I have like 30 hats to choose from, having to position them every time SUCKS, and sometimes they reset for seemingly no reason. 

- Youtube: Good and bad. You can find really good tutorials on Youtube on how to set this up! Its great, but its also like, okay? You need to search to find info on use the program, and it's kind of sad it doesn't have a tutorial or something to give you a basic run down, but it's a program that's not too expensive, so you get what you pay for. It's still really good.

Stream Avatars is a software that streamers can use to create avatars for viewers to interact with on their live stream. It is an incredible tool to add user interactivity to just about [u]ANY[/u] stream. 

Streamers can create custom actions for their avatars (aside from the default actions of Idle, Walk, Sit, Stand and Jump) and also create animations to replace the default action animations like !jump and !sit. The only limitation is your creativity. For those that are less than artistic, or don't have time to create their own avatars - The discord and workshop have a large number of pre-made avatars submitted by the community; the software also comes with some pre-made avatars/accessories (gear).

Stream Avatars is easy enough to traverse and the support team in the discord is more than helpful and responsive with any questions users may have. This software is consistently being updated with new features and community content. I HIGHLY recommend this to all streamers looking to add meaningful content to their community. 

*Make sure if you are a Twitch user to download the [b]Stream Avatars Twitch Extension[/b] for your viewers, as it will allow them to easily change their avatars with the click of a button - as opposed to a !command
